2024
Admission Ongoing!

Start Equiry ViaWhatsApp

Pacific Academy

Sebiolatan Joshua
(B.A., PGDE)

Principal

Greetings from the principal

I feel highly privileged to lead one of the best Secondary Schools in Nigeria where young generations are provided with great opportunities to flourish. At Pacific Academy, we strongly believe that young people learn effectively only when they feel happy and secure and it is our aim to ensure that we achieve this goal in our just like we have been doing for decades in Lagos.

Our paramount objective is to make every student succeed using a team of professionally qualified and inspirational teachers and administrative staff to create remarkable value for all our students and other stakeholders.

For us at Pacific Academy, our aim is to strive to unlock the full potential of every student through support, inspirational teaching, opportunities, and experiences that will boost his confidence and prepare him for future challenges.

Our superb facilities, dedicated and motivated teachers, friendly and serene environment will enable us to deliver on the above promises.

I, therefore, look forward with all enthusiasm to welcoming you to the Community of the next generation of leaders that will further revolutionize the world for betterment.

Academic Curricular

Our curriculum is based on the Nigerian educational system, having three junior sections (JSS1 – JSS3) and three senior sections (SSS1 – SSS3).

We offer the following subjects:

  1. Languages (English, French, Yoruba)
  2. Arts (History, Government, Literature, Christian Religious Studies)
  3. Science and Math (Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Further Mathematics, Computer Science, Technical Drawing, Basic Science and Technology)
  4. Social Sciences (Economics, Geography, National Value Education)
  5. Vocational Studies (Agricultural Science, Home Economics)
  6. Business Studies (Financial Accounting, Commerce, Book Keeping)

Co-Curricular

We offer the following Curriculum Enrichment subjects such as:

  • Financial literacy where students are taught personal finance and money management skills.
  • Study skills (learning how to learn) where students are taught how to study.
  • Critical thinking where students are taught to think clearly, logically, and independently to proffer solutions to problems.
  • Leadership skills
  • Character Education

Extracurricular activities: Clubs and societies (Jet club, Chess club, press club, swimming, etc.

Our Facilities

Campus Environment

Library

Transport

Chemistry Laboratory

Physics Laboratory

Cultural and Creative Art Studio

Sports

Results

Click here to visit the result portal

Testimonials

———–

News and Events

Locate us
